results.title: Joey: the autobiography of Joey Deacon (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Goodchild, Brian Gibson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Joey Deacon, born in 1920 with brain damage, grew up severely spastic, unable to talk or walk. When, in 1928, his mother died, he was sent to an institution where he lived for years, quite unable to make himself understood. Then, in 1941, he met Ernie Roberts who had one remarkable skill - he could understand Joey. This led to a new and richer life, and this film tells Joey’s remarkable story. Based on Joey Deacon’s book “Tongue tied”.

results.title: Joey runs away (K)
results.creator_credit: Paul R. Gagne, Weston Woods Studios and Daniel Ivanick
results.brief_description: Joey, a young kangaroo, tired of his mother’s complaints about his messy room in her pouch, decides to run away. While Joey searches for a new home, word gets around that his mother has an empty room. What follows will entertain children of all ages. Based on the book by Jack Kent.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: Michael Lake, Village Roadshow Pictures and Ian Barry
results.brief_description: Kangaroos hold a special place in Billy’s (Jamie Croft) heart, he even trespasses to protect them from being hunted on neighbouring Queensland farms. His evil neighbour, Dixon (Errol O’Neill) hires a Kanga Catcher who drugs the kangaroos and transports them to the city, all but a lonely joey who Billy rescues. Together with the daughter of an American ambassador, boy, girl and joey begin a journey to reunite the young kangaroo with its kidnapped family. An adventure film that the whole family will enjoy. Cast also includes Alex McKenna, Rebecca Gibney, Ed Begley Jr and Ruth Cracknell.

results.title: Joey
results.creator_credit: Peter Jones, ONF | NFB and Graham Parker
results.brief_description: He was a likable seven-year-old boy, but he had been abandoned by his parents. He was first placed in a foster home; later, new parents were found for him. Joey is a story of adoption as seen from the child’s point of view. Made with the cooperation of the Children’s Aid Society, the film shows the measure of success that adoption authorities are experiencing today in placing older children.

results.title: Joe Petit Boum-Boum
results.brief_description:
Joe has saved the royal beehive from being vandalised by a gang of nasty children. As a reward, the Queen invites Joe to visit her royal palace. Reduced to insect size, Joe embarks on the exploration of the bees’ tiny kingdom.

Credits: Director, Jean Image ; writers, Jean Image, France Image ; photograhy, T. Tchikine ; music, Michel Emer.
Cast: Laurence Badie, Roger Carel, Chritiane Legrand, Linette Lemercier [voices only].

results.title: Joe Mcbain: blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Nina Syme, Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Joe McBain started as an apprentice blacksmith, in 1916, at a general blacksmith shop. These shops were involved in woodwork, mending farm equipment and shoeing horses. In this film, Joe talks about old blacksmithing methods.

results.title: Joe Leahy's Neighbours
results.brief_description: Joe Leahy’s Neighbours is a film of truly compelling interest, one of the greatest documentaries made in Australia in recent years. Fashioned from the material shot by Bob Connolly and Robin Anderson during an extended stay in the Papua New Guinea highlands, it presents a portrait of a society only slowly adjusting to the demands of a modern world - a society caught between ancient tribal loyalties and the sharp business practices of the twentieth century. Rated: G

results.title: Joe Jacobs: stone carver
results.creator_credit: BT Film-Sound, National Indian Arts and Crafts and Geoff Voyce
results.brief_description: Documentary on stone carving. Joe Jacobs found he had a talent for carving after an accident in the building trade by using simple hand tools to depict his American Indian heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BT Film-Sound, National Indian Arts and Crafts and Geoff Voyce

results.title: Joe Dirt
results.creator_credit: Robert Simonds, Happy Madison Productions, Columbia Pictures and Dennie Gordon
results.brief_description: Joe Dirt (David Spade) is a janitor, has a ‘mullet’ hairstyle and is the butt of many jokes in the building where he works. Abandoned as a child at the Grand Canyon by his birth parents, Joe is raised by foster parents, until he makes the decision to find his family and ask them why they left him behind. When he is discovered by a radio DJ (Dennis Miller) in Los Angeles, Joe goes live on air and shares the adventures he had while searching for his parents with the listeners, captivating the entire city. Cast also includes Christopher Walken, Brittany Daniel, Kid Rock and Jaime Pressley.

results.title: Joe and the sleeping beauty
results.brief_description: The Queen Bee, Honeyflower is placed under a spell by One Sting Maude, a witch from the tsetse family, jealous of the Queen Bee’s beauty. Bzz, the Bee-guide enlists the help of Joe to help save the Queen. He is given an injection to shrink him to the size of an insect and enters the parlour of the sleeping beauty, Honeyflower. Written by Frame and Jean Image with music by Michael Emer.
